member.name: T:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket
member.summary: Class that manages a packet data. Static members should be thread safe, instance members are not thread safe. Ideally GamePackets should be used with a limited set amout of different MaxCapacity values with UsePools active, which will allow for easy pooling with as little allocations as possible. GamePackets that have finished their use should be disposed through DisposePacket

member.name: P:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.UsePools
member.summary: Determines whenever pools should be used. Pools are divided through MaxCapacity

member.name: M:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.CreatePacket(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an initializated packet instance

member.name: M:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.CreatePacket(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Gets an initializated packet instance. MaxCapacity will be equal to dala.Length
member.param: buffer to use as the internal buffer of the packet. MaxCapacity == data.Length

member.name: M:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.ClearInternalPools
member.summary: Performs a clear in all internal pools, releasing all resources

member.name: M:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.SetUsePools(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Setter for the UsePools variable. Pools are divided through MaxCapacity
member.param: Determines whenever pools should be used. Pools are divided through MaxCapacity

member.name: F:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.CurrentLength
member.summary: Amount of bytes that has been written in the packet. This may not return a correct value if already written data in the packet has been overwritten or if methods other than the given Write methods in this class has been used to modify the internal buffer, and it must be reset manually. GamePackets created through CreatePacket will be already resetted. This value has no impact in the internal logic of GamePacket and should be used as a way to store the current amount of written byte data

member.name: F:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.CurrentSeek
member.summary: Current seek position in the packet, used for all Read/Write operations

member.name: P:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.IsDisposed
member.summary: Determines whenever the current instance has been disposed through DestroyPacket. Disposed packets should not be used

member.name: P:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.MaxCapacity
member.summary: Max capacity of the packet. Write/Read operations that go beyond this limit will throw exceptions

member.name: P:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.Data
member.summary: Internal buffer used by the packet Changes done to the buffer directly will not automatically modify the other variables

member.name: M:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.DisposePacket
member.summary: Operation that disposes the current packet. if UsePools is true the disposed instance will be pooled, id UsePools is false it does nothing

member.name: M:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.Copy(VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Copies n elements from internal buffer of the given gamepacket starting from its seek position to the current instance. Elements copied are equal to the minimum between the packet to (copy current length - seek pos), the space effectively available starting from vopy seek pos and the space available in the current instance buffer.
member.param: effective number of elements copied successfully

member.name: M:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.ReadByteData(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the internal buffer into the given array
member.param: buffer on which the internal buffer elements will be written

member.name: M:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.ReadByteData(VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the internal buffer into the given array
member.param: buffer on which the internal buffer elements will be written. Buffer Seek will not be moved

member.name: M:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.ReadByteData(VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the internal buffer into the given array
member.param: buffer on which the internal buffer elements will be written. Buffer Seek will not be moved

member.name: M:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.ReadByteData(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the internal buffer into the given array
member.param: buffer on which the internal buffer elements will be written

member.name: M:VOCASY.Utility.GamePacket.WriteByteData(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes the given byte array into the internal buffer
member.param: buffer from which elements will be written on the internal buffer

member.summary: Writes the given byte array into the internal buffer
member.param: buffer from which elements will be written on the internal buffer

member.summary: Writes the given byte array into the internal buffer

member.summary: Writes the given byte array into the internal buffer
